lines.text: Look, lady, or whoever you are, I accepted a ride from you to Joe's Haven. And that's all you need to know about me.
Bitch.
The black chick might come in handy.
Did you ever hear of a thing called spying?
Hear of it? I invented it.
First of all, I'm not what you think I am.
I know. You're a Girl Scout working on your badge for the equality of niggers.
I'm a government agent.
Oh yeah? Well, I'm Snow White suffering from a sunburn.

[turning off the lights in preparation for a fight]
You want it black? You got it black.
[first lines]
Hey, brother, how you doin'?
They call me T.N.T.
Listen, honey, and you get it straight. I'm not in your league. I work standing up, not on my back.
Really? How amusing. I've never really tried it that way.
Do you think she knows that you're in the heroin business?
I believe the black woman might have some knowledge of this.
I want to form a squad of the finest fighters in the city.
This is agreeable to me.
It wouldn't be murder. More like self-defense. It's obvious she could lose some weight.
Me, T.N.T.? Working for the pigs?
He sent me your address asking me to send him some money. Instead, I sent him a piece of my mind. I just want to know if he got it.
[last lines]

[to Charlie]
The name is Diana Jackson. T.N.T. to you.
